definition: lit. severe floods and fierce beasts (idiom)/fig. great scourges/extremely dangerous or threatening things
surname Hong
flood/big/great
surname Shui
water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes
ferocious/fierce/violent/brave/suddenly/abrupt/(slang) awesome
beast/animal/beastly/bestial

sentences.english: A person that does not get online, often inspect a network to be great scourges .
sentences.chinese: 一个从来不上网的人，常常视网络为洪水猛兽。

sentences.english: Top-down discrimination, such as a scourge, was out of control.
sentences.chinese: 自上而下的歧视如洪水猛兽，一发不可收拾。

sentences.english: They are human beings, not a scourge and the god of plague.
sentences.chinese: 他们也是人，并非洪水猛兽和瘟神。

jackals, wolves, tigers and panthers (idiom)/animals who are dangerous to man and cattle/fierce and cruel people

double-edged sword (lit. and fig.)

demons and ghosts/ghouls and bogies
